snippet: Once again, a tug-of-war over abortion is dividing the Republican Party, and two developments in California this week underscore the strains.    Top Republican officials converged at this community of spas and golf courses near Palm Springs today ...
lead_paragraph: Once again, a tug-of-war over abortion is dividing the Republican Party, and two developments in California this week underscore the strains. Top Republican officials converged at this community of spas and golf courses near Palm Springs today for the party's winter meeting with the chief goal of defeating a resolution to withhold party money to candidates who oppose banning late-term abortions. Most prominent Republicans, even foes of abortion, have avoided the controversy or denounced the resolution as at odds with efforts to broaden the party.
abstract: Abortion issue once again roils Republican party, as leaders gather for winter meeting with chief goal of defeating resolution to withhold party funds from candidates who oppose ban on late-term abortions; split is likely to widen even if resolution fails, particularly now that conservative Tom J Bordonaro has placed ahead of moderate Brooks Firestone in special House election in California; party leaders Newt Gingrich and Trent Lott restate support for ban on late-term abortion, but do not mention resolution; even Dan Quayle privately urges measure's defeat (S)

headline.main: Late-Term Abortion Issue Pulls Republicans in Two Directions
